title: Is Greece On The Rebound?
teaser: The parliament in Athens today approved the country's first balanced budget in decades after a $300 billion bailout in 2010.
contentencoded:
The parliament in Athens today approved the country’s first balanced budget in decades.

Does that mean Greece has recovered from the economic strife that led to a $300 billion bailout in 2010?

Reporter Joanna Kakissis in Athens talks with Here & Now‘s Jeremy Hobson about what this news means for Greece.

Guest

  • Joanna Kakissis, a NPR contributing reporter in Athens. She tweets @joannakakissis.
